Copyright (c) 2019 Dylan Burati\nIcon: Keyboard by Shocho from the Noun Project
Projects you create will be listed here.\n\nTo get started, you can click the menu in the top right and import the default project.

The piano roll is a visual representation of a piece of music, similar to sheet music. The x-axis is time, which is divided into bars or measures (dark line) and quarter notes. The y-axis is pitch, which goes from C1 to B8 (middle C is C4).

To add a note to the piano roll, long click
To remove a note, long click on it
To select a note, tap it

Notes about time representation: There are 24 ticks per sixteenth, and 16 sixteenths per bar.
